isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - INSTALL - Differential Carrier in the Axle Housing

svcproc.title: Differential Carrier in the Axle Housing

warning.para: Be careful when using cleaning solvents. Follow the solvent manufacturer's instructions for safe use to prevent serious personal injury.

step1.para: Clean the inside of the axle housing and the mounting surface where the carrier fastens. Use a cleaning solvent and rags to remove dirt. Blow dry the cleaned areas with air. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT.
Inspect the axle housing for damage. Repair or replace the axle housing. Refer to REPAIRING THE AXLE BY WELDING.
Check for loose studs in the mounting surface of the housing where the carrier fastens. Remove and clean the studs that are loose.
Re-install the studs in the axle housing. Tighten the studs to 150 to 230 ft-lbs. (203 to 312 Nm).

warning.para: Small amounts of acid vapor are present when applying silicone gasket material. To prevent possible serious personal injury, make sure there is good ventilation in the work area. If the silicone gasket material gets in your eyes, flush your eyes with water for 15 minutes. Have your eyes checked by a doctor.

step1.para: Apply the proper RTV silicone gasket material to the mounting surface of the housing where the carrier fastens ( Figure 156). Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended liquid gasket material.

note.para: On axles that use a main differential lock, the lock MUST be shifted into and held in the locked (engaged) position. The locked position gives enough clearance between the shift collar and the axle housing to permit the installation of the carrier. Refer to DRIVER CONTROLLED MAIN DIFFERENTIAL LOCK .

step1.para: Install the carrier into the axle housing. Use a hydraulic roller jack or a lifting tool ( Figure 157).

caution.para: Do not use a hammer or a mallet to install the carrier. A hammer or a mallet will damage the mounting flange of the carrier and cause oil leaks.

figure.caption: Figure 157. Install Carrier into Axle Housing

step1.para: Install the nuts and the washers or the bolts and the washers in the four corner locations around the carrier and the axle housing. Tighten the fasteners by hand. DO NOT TIGHTEN TO THE SPECIFIED TORQUE ( Figure 158).
Carefully push the carrier into position. Alternately tighten the four fasteners two or three turns each ( Figure 158).
Repeat Step 7 until the four fasteners are tightened to the correct torque value. Refer to the Torque Chart.
Install the remaining fasteners and the washers that hold the carrier in the axle housing. Tighten the fasteners to the correct torque value. Refer to the Torque Chart.
Install the gaskets and the axle shafts into the axle housing and the carrier. The gasket and the flange of the axle shafts must fit flat against the wheel hub ( Figure 159).
If the wheel hubs have tapered hole studs, install the tapered dowels at each stud and on the flange of the axle shaft ( Figure 159).

figure.caption: Figure 159. Install Gaskets, Axle Shafts, and Tapered Dowels

step1.para: If the wheel hubs have straight hole studs, install the nuts and the washers on the studs. Tighten the nuts to the correct torque value. Refer to the Torque Chart.
Position the gasket between the output shaft bearing cage and the axle housing.
Install the output shaft and bearing cage assembly into the axle housing. Rotate the output shaft to align the splines of the output shaft with the splines of the rear side gear.
Clean the output bearing cage to housing bolts thoroughly. Remove excessive RTV residue from the thru drilled tapped holes.
Apply Loctite 518 in the thru drilled tapped holes (2, 5 and 8 o'clock positions). Use approximately .25 inch (6.35 mm) bead length ( Figure 160).
Spray the bolt threads with Loctite Primer N. Allow the primer to dry 3 to 5 minutes.
Install the washers and tighten the bolts that fasten the output bearing cage to the axle housing. Tighten the bolts to 35 to 50 ft-lbs. (48 to 67 Nm).
Allow 4 hours for the Loctite #518 sealant to cure before returning the vehicle to service.
Loosen the jam nut on the adjusting bolt ( Figure 161).

note.para: Make sure that the adjusting bolt does not touch the shift shaft when the shift collar engages the inter-axle differential case.

figure.caption: Figure 161. Loosen Jam Nut on Adjusting Bolt

step1.para: Apply and hold 60 psi of air pressure to the shift cylinder so that the shift collar engages the splines in the inter-axle differential case.
Tighten the adjusting bolt until the tip of the bolt touches the end of the shift shaft.
Release the air pressure.
Tighten the adjusting bolt an additional 1 turn. Then tighten the jam nut ( Figure 162).

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. TIGHTEN ADJUSTING BOLT 1 TURN AFTER BOLT TOUCHES END OF SHAFT
2. APPLY 60 PSI (613 KPA) OF AIR PRESSURE HERE

step1.para: Loosen the jam nut on the adjusting bolt.
Tighten the adjusting bolt until the tip of the bolt touches the end of the shift shaft.
Apply and hold 60 psi of air pressure to disengage the splines in the inter-axle differential case.
Tighten the adjusting bolt an additional one turn. Tighten the jam nut.
Release air pressure.

Check that the inter-axle differential is disengaged by holding the input yoke or flange and rotating the output yoke or flange. The output yoke or flange should rotate with less than 50 ft-lbs. (67 Nm) torque applied.
Check that the shift collar engages the splines in the inter-axle differential case. When the input yoke or flange is rotated, the output yoke or flange must rotate.
Apply a rust prevention oil such as Rockwell Part Number 1199-U-1113 or equivalent to the inlet of the air cylinder.
Connect the vehicle driveshafts to the input and the output yokes or flanges.
Connect the air lines to the inter-axle differential air cylinder and (if used) the main differential lock cylinder.
On axles with a main differential lock, connect the electrical connector of the sensor unit. Make sure the main differential lock is disengaged.
If removed, install the oil filter adapter onto the differential carrier. Use Rockwell Adhesive 2297-C-3747 or Loctite 277. Tighten the adapter to 40 to 60 ft-lbs. (55 to 80 Nm) ( Figure 163).

caution.para: If the oil filter is tightened more than 3/4 of a turn after it contacts the carrier, the oil filter will be damaged and leak fluid.

step1.para: Lubricate the gasket of the new oil filter with axle lubricant. Install the oil filter on the adapter. Tighten the oil filter 3/4 of a turn after the gasket on the filter contacts the carrier. If necessary, use an oil filter wrench to tighten the filter ( Figure 163).
Fill the axle with lubricant. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Make sure the vehicle is parked on a level surface.
Fill the axle with lubricant until the lubricant level is to the bottom of the fill plug hole ( Figure 164).
Install the fill plug and tighten to a minimum torque of 35 ft-lbs. (47 Nm). When correctly installed, one complete thread of the fill plug is visible.
Road test the vehicle in an unloaded condition for 1 to 2 miles (1.6 to 3.2 km) at speeds not more than 25 mph (40 kmh). Recheck the lubricant levels and all the fasteners.
If used, check the operation of the driver controlled main differential lock.
